intro: Pachylobus buettneri var. cinera, commonly known as the silver-leaved pachylobus, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to the coastal regions of southern Africa, particularly South Africa. The plant is characterized by its distinctive silvery-gray foliage, which gives it its common name. It produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in late winter to early spring. This variety is often cultivated for its ornamental value and its ability to thrive in coastal environments.
